intro: Hieracium kranri, commonly known as the mountain hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its bright yellow flowers and hairy, often reddish stems. Native to the alpine regions of Europe, it thrives in rocky and open habitats. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters and has basal leaves that are lance-shaped. It is known for its ability to colonize disturbed sites and is often found in meadows and grasslands at high altitudes.
